skills.name: Manipulate one equation so that it is in a form to be added or subtracted
Manipulate both equations so that they are in a form to be added or subtracted
Recognise whether you need to add or subtract linear equations in order to eliminate a variable

explanations.A: Not quite. The aim of transforming the equations is to make the coefficient in front of m the same for both equations. Multiplying equation 1 by 3 gives 9m - 3n = 90 and multiplying equation 2 by 2 gives 4m + 6n = 44. 9m is not the same as 4m, therefore we will not be able to eliminate m. Which of the other transformations will ensure that the coefficients in front of the m is the same for both equations?
explanations.B: To eliminate the variable m we need the coefficient of m to be the same in both equations. Multiplying equation 1 by 2 gives 6m - 2n = 60. Multiplying equation 2 by 3 gives 6m + 9n = 66. As both coefficients are now +6 we can subtract one of the equations from the other to eliminate the variable m.
